abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the National Water Supply
            and Sanitation Project for Moldova were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory, risk to development outcome
            was substantial, and Bank and Borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            second generation projects must build on earlier operations,
            rely on adequate sector assessment, be calibrated with
            government's commitment to reform, and maintain a
            continuous policy dialogue with clients. Well-functioning
            project implementation unit's (PIUs) are essential for
            project implementation. Structure, staffing, internal
            organization, reporting lines, decision authority, and
            performance incentives should be carefully crafted and
            closely monitored at all times during implementation.
            Support towards institutional arrangements in rural areas
            should be based on an agreed strategy. Investments should be
            accompanied by technical assistance for management and
            maintenance of acquired assets and infrastructure, improved
            service delivery, and social engagement.
